sen.j: 智恵光院通（ちえこういんどおり）は京都市内の南北の通りの一つ。
sen.e: Chiekoin-dori Street is one of the south and north street in Kyoto City.
Chiekoin-dori Street is a street running north-south through Kyoto City.
Chiekoin-dori Street is a street running north-south through Kyoto City.

sen.j: 北は北大路通の大徳寺門前から南は竹屋町通の二条城の北の堀端まで、大宮通と千本通の間を走る。
sen.e: The street runs between Omiya-dori Street and Senbon-dori Street, which is from in front of the Daitoku-ji Temple on Kitaoji-dori Street at north, to the edge of a moat at north in Nijo Catsle which is on Takeyamachi-dori Street at south.

The street runs between Omiya-dori and Senbon-dori Street, from the front of Daitoku-ji Temple on Kitaoji-dori Street in the north, to the edge of a moat on the northern side of Nijo Catsle which is on Takeyamachi-dori Street in the south.

The street runs between Omiya-dori and Senbon-dori Street, from the front of Daitoku-ji Temple on Kitaoji-dori Street in the north, to the edge of a moat on the northern side of Nijo-jo Catsle which is on Takeyamachi-dori Street in the south.

sen.j: 途中、寺之内通と丸太町通で鍵の手に折れる。
sen.e: On the way, it turns to Teranouchi-dori Street and Marutamachi-dori Street.
On the way, it turns to Teranouchi-dori Street and Marutamachi-dori Street.
On the way, it turns to Teranouchi-dori Street and Marutamachi-dori Street.

sen.j: また、下立売通の南方で約25～30m間 北西⇔南東に遷移する区間がある。
sen.e: Also there is the section which switches north and west to south and east back and forth, its about between 25 to 30m at south side on Shimotateuri-dori Street.
Also there is a section on the south side of Shimotateuri-dori Street about 25-30 m long which switches back and forth between being north-west to south-east.
Also there is a section on the south side of Shimodachiuri-dori Street about 25-30 m long which switches back and forth between being north-west to south-east.
sen.cmt: 下立売（しもだちうり）通の読みを訂正

sen.j: 南の延長線上、御池通から南に矢城通、さらに南に壬生川通（壬生通）がある。
sen.e: Yashiro-dori Street is located in south from Oike-dori Street on the extended line at south, and Mibugawa-dori Street (Mibu-dori Street) is located more south.
sen.cmt: 矢城通→Yashiro-dori Street[正確な読みが確認できませんでした]
sen.e: Yashiro-dori Street runs south from Oike-dori Street on the southern extension, while Mibugawa-dori Street (Mibu-dori Street) is located even further south.
Yashiro-dori Street runs south from Oike-dori Street on the southern extension, while Mibugawa-dori Street (Mibu-dori Street) is located even further south.

sen.j: 寺之内通以北は住宅地の中を走る細い通り、寺之内通から丸太町通までは両側に歩道も設けられた2車線道路だが、通過する車両は比較的少ない。
sen.e: The narrow street which runs into the residential area which is located more north from Teranouchi-dori Street, there is two driveways with sidewalks at both side from Teranouchi-dori Street to Marutacho-dori Street, but relatively there is not many cars passing.

The narrow street runs into a residential area is located further north from Teranouchi-dori Street, where there are two driveways with sidewalks on both sides from Teranouchi-dori Street to Marutacho-dori Street, with relatively low traffic.

The narrow street runs into a residential area is located further north from Teranouchi-dori Street, where there are two driveways with sidewalks on both sides from Teranouchi-dori Street to Marutamachi-dori Street, with relatively low traffic.
sen.cmt: 丸太町(まるたまち)通の読みを訂正

sen.j: 1964年1月27日までは京都市営バス25号系統の運行経路の一部として寺之内⇔丸太町間、また1981年5月29日の系統廃止までは今出川⇔丸太町間が設定されていた。
sen.e: The route between Teranouchi and Marutacho-dori Street was established as a part of the route of Kyoto City bus 25 series until January 27, 1964, also the route between Imadegawa and Marutamachi was established until March 29, 1981 when the series was abolished.

The route between Teranouchi and Marutacho-dori Street was established as a part of the route for the Kyoto City Bus 25 series until January 27, 1964, and was also the route between Imadegawa and Marutamachi which was established until March 29, 1981 when the series was abolished.

The route between Teranouchi and Marutamachi was established as a part of the route for the Kyoto City Bus 25 series until January 27, 1964, and was also the route between Imadegawa and Marutamachi which was established until March 29, 1981 when the series was abolished.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせ、Marutacho-dori Street→Marutamachiとしました。

sen.j: 名前は一条通上ルにある智恵光院からつけられた。
sen.e: The name of street came from Chieko-in Temple which is located in Ichijo-dori agaru.
The name of street came from Chieko-in Temple which is located in Ichijo-dori agaru.
The name of street came from Chieko-in Temple which is located in Ichijo-dori agaru.
